reviews.title: The Most Amazing Ocean View, I've Ever Even Heard of...
reviews.text: Essaouira is a magnificent coastal destination and if you are looking for a room with a view, Riad Mimouna is the place to go. The riad sits right along the sea wall. Rooms facing the ocean have really cool weathered, pane windows that open to allow in the fresh sea air and cool breezes. The strong surf breaks on rocks about a hundred meters from the hotel, making for spectacular views and sounds, making even your room a great place to just hang out. We sat for nearly two hours with the windows open, bathing in the cool breezes and the crashing waves.

reviews.title: Stunning Views and Lovely Riad/Hotel
reviews.text: If you are into that sort of thing, the riad has in-room television and does have wifi, however, you can't use it in the rooms. You have to go into the lobby but there is plenty of lounge area. The showers are about the same as all that we have found across the country: A good supply of hot water and a detachable shower head that has been detached a few too many times, probably because most Moroccans haven't adapted the western practice of standing under a shower head, but there are no issues with the facilities, whatsoever.

reviews.title: Excellent service
reviews.text: The rooms are nicely furnished with a simplicity that fits Essaouira perfectly. The restaurant is located on the top floor with sliding windows that allow access to the sounds and breezes during your meals. The food was very good, I recommend the risotto with prawns oh so highly! If you are in the mood for wine (and Morocco has some really good wines, lemme tell you), you cannot order them from the menu, but a discussion with local taxi drivers can get you directed to places that will sell it, and the riad allows you to bring it in and consume it.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, amazing sea views
reviews.text: Beyond the restaurant is the roof top, which gives an excellent view of the old city and the ocean. Floor to roof, this riad is beautiful, well staffed with friendly people and in an excellent location. It is located in the medina, a short distance from the central square and all along the route you will find vendors and local artists. An awesome destination that made our stay in Essaouira nothing short of amazing!

reviews.title: Stop looking and book this hotel...you will never regret it!!!
reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the Mimouna and we chose a junior suite - Room 310 again. The room, with 2 windows facing the sea, and 2 more facing the side of the Riad and city walls, gives you a 270 degree view of the city, the beach and the fabulous crashing waves ! The views from the Terrace are also spectacular. Breakfast is above average - the usual breads, orange juice, coffee, tea, cake etc plus yoghurt, cheese, boiled (or other form on request) egg, bottle of water. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Wifi is available in the Reception area, but not in the Rooms. There is also a PC in the Reception area for free use by guests. The Riad is not licenced to serve alcohol.

reviews.title: Location, location, location - wish I could have stayed forever!
reviews.text: We booked direct (better rate) and had a room on the third floor (304) overlooking the sea and just under the top floor restaurant. It had all we needed - comfy bed, chairs, wardrobe space and the bathroom with shower was fine. It was heavenly to lie in bed and watch the seagulls flying past and hear the waves crashing on the rocks below. The breakfast was plentiful - baguettes, Moroccan bread, croissants/pains chocolats plus boiled eggs, yoghurt, cheese, jams, cakes, freshly squeezed orange juice and coffee - it kept us going all day...The room next door was a suite - much more spacious but you don't come here to stay in your room and there's so much to see/buy that you could spend your money better in the medina! The location is absolutely fabulous and we did not find a better place to stay. True, if money is no object you could stay at the Heure Bleue Palais for €300 a night but it does not have the authenticity of a Riad and at three times the price, more or less. The team on reception were great with tips on where to buy the best quality goods. Wifi in reception is fine - there are plenty of areas where you can sit and the fact that it is not in the room is really not a big issue - life is for experiencing not wasting holiday time on emails! We stayed for four nights and would go back tomorrow!

reviews.title: Just splendid view...
reviews.text: Ok, its in d medina and right on the sea rocks so views fm every room n the terrace is excellent. But no wifi in d room as u hv to come down to recptn area to be connected. Sad, thy must improve on this. Std rooms are very basic n small in area about 15sq.m....

reviews.title: Splendid view, lovely rooms, food and service could be better
reviews.text: Breakfast is avg...staff are very friendly n helpful. Overall its a good hotel...

reviews.title: Stunning views. Only stopped here for lunch
reviews.text: Our room overlooked the sea and the view was gorgeous. The room was large and very comfortable and the bathroom was wonderfully spacious. it is very conveniently located in the medina with the restaurants close by. The room was more like a hotel room and not a riad.

reviews.title: Beautiful lobby and great ocean view from our room
reviews.text: We found the service not as great as in the other riads and auberges in Morocco - no welcome with mint tea, set check-out time of 12 noon though we were perhaps the only guests at the riad and were leaving at 2pm, the room being cleaned even before we checked out etc. In the riads, the managers always made time for Moroccan hospitality and asked us if everything was ok. Not so here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel were the views were the best I guess in Essaouira. To look out of the window and see and hear the sea so close is quite thrilling.Even in the night you could hear the crashing waves. To sit on the terrace in the summer must be lovely but in February - March when it is still cool it is not such a good idea. The restaurant lacks ambiance which is a shame.In the evening it was slightly better when they lit the candles. The food was enjoyable and the service was friendly. But I do think that more could be done. It would help that in the winter months one could have a meal downstairs somewhere.
reviews.title: Fantastic sea view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in Essaoura - this riad/hotel has charm though in January it was dark - probably in hot weather this would give respite from the glare of the sun. We were in a sea view suite - room very comfortable and once heater put on it was warm. Sea crashing outside at high tide was very dramatic. Breakfast on the terrace was wonderful - though watching the mussel pickers dodge the waves was sometimes heart-stopping. The lighting in the alleyway outside at night was not working a torch would have been a useful piece of equipment to have.
reviews.title: Stunning Sea Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With 4th floor rooftop - and restaurant-view directly over the sea and the crashing waves on the coastal cliffs it is truly spectacular. A room or 'mini-suite' with ocean view is a must, even if you do not spend much time in the room - opening the window in the morning to the spectacular view is truly great. Escaping from cold and wet Switzerland mid January, Essaouira is superb. Park your rental car at Bab Marrakech, pay your 30 Dirhans to the parking attendant, and then walk through the gate and keep going straight (500m) until the road ends, turn left and continue 100m and you have arrived. If you have heavy luggage there are plenty transport guys around who will load your stuff into a wagon and get it to the Riad.
reviews.title: Top Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Low season January there were few guests, Staff was throughout cordial and helpful, Breakfast was ample and good. Rooms were clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom was odorless - devoid of the sewer smells that can hit you in the medina streets (fortunately a few meters on you have all the great smells of the spices, leather, perfumes, and fruit of Morocco).
reviews.title: Amazing location and view, average on all other counts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If there is one thing that we missed in the room was adequate lights for reading after dark. Hopefully this will be changed by the next time we visit.
reviews.title: Great place where to stay in Essaouira, the best possible view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location actually IN the wall of the Medina at the edge of the ocean is surely what makes this riad appealing. Not much more can be said about the accommodations. We actually like the sound of the surf at night but yes, it could be loud and the windows don't seal well. A wind tunnel was created when you left them open.
reviews.title: Location is it's main draw...everything else - meh
Nice riad but shame about the dog
reviews.text: The lighting in the room was very dark. The bed was as hard as a rock and the linens and towels were rough. The toilet worked only every other flush. The sleep quotient was low.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely but the staff, in general was aloof. The internet was frustratingly intermittent.
reviews.title: great location
High drama in your bedroom!
reviews.text: Since this was our first Riad stay, we thought this was the norm in Morocco but we found many other locations during our travels with beautiful, comfortable accommodations and warm and friendly people. They would do well to step up their game to match the spectacular location.

This riad was really lovely to stay in, the staff were accommodating and pleasant and the breakfasts were very nice. However, animal lovers beware, next to the hotel is a dog on a roof terrace that is tied up for 23 hrs a day, sitting in its own mess and held tight by a lead that doesn't allow him to move around or even reach his water. This is very distressing for tourists like myself who aren't used to this type of treatment and I suggest the hotel look into this quickly as its not a pleasant view from the roof terrace
reviews.title: Nice but noisy
